headline.main: National Briefing | South: Puerto Rico: More Protests Planned

lead_paragraph: Protesters on Vieques island said they planned to resume their campaign of civil disobedience, suspended after the Sept. 11 attacks, to halt Navy bombing exercises on the island. The announcement came as senior Navy officers asked the Pentagon for permission to resume training with live ammunition, a practice suspended for two years, on the range because of the war on terrorism. Protesters, who say the war games harm the environment and residents' health, have tried to disrupt the exercises by trespassing at the site.
